intro: Crepis polymorpha, commonly known as the common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features basal rosettes of gray-green, hairy leaves and produces small, dandelion-like yellow flowers. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions. Crepis polymorpha is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides.
